Trains a Pavlovian HeiDI

Source: R/train_pav_heidi.R
train_pav_heidi.Rd

Trains a Pavlovian HeiDI

Usage

train_pav_heidi(
  sals,
  cons,
  w,
  tps,
  trials,
  trial_names = NULL,
  phase = NULL,
  block_size = NULL,
  train = rep(TRUE, length(tps)),
  targets = "US"
)

Arguments

sals

A named vector with stimulus saliencies.

cons

A named vector with stimulus constants.

w

A named array of dimensions S,S; where S is the number of stimuli.

tps

A vector of trial pointers for training, as a function of trials.

trials

A list of length T, with character vectors specifying the stimuli involved in each trial. T is the number of unique trials in the experiment.

trial_names

(optional) A character vector of length T with the names of the trials

phase

(optional) A character vector of length T with the names of the phases

block_size

(optional) A integer vector of length T specifying the block size per trial

train

(optional) A logical vector specifying whether the trial should result in learning (update w). Helpful with tests.

targets

A character vector specifying the target stimulus for each trial. Under development. For now, just the US.

Value

A list with

  • ws - An array of dimensions P,S,S; where P is the number of trials used to train the model and S is the number of stimuli involved in the experiment.

  • rs,combvs, chainvs - Lists of length P with the r-values, combination vs, and chain vs.

  • tps, trials, trial_names, phase, block_size - Carryover for further processing. See Arguments.

Note

The array w contains the associations for all stimuli involved in the experiment. Entry i,j specifies the associative strength between stimulus i to stimulus j. Entry j,i specifies the opposite direction.
